brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to characterize the pharmacokinetics of once daily topical gel
      and confirm that steady state conditions are reached under maximal use conditions following
      3 weeks of daily applications.

clinical_study.brief_title: A 21 Day Pharmacokinetics Study in Papulopustular Rosacea

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  A diagnosis of papulopustular rosacea

          -  Grade 3 or 4 on the 5-point Investigator Global Assessment scale

          -  Presence of telangiectasia

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  steroid rosacea or subtype 3 (phymatous rosacea)

          -  clinically significant abnormal findings that would interfere with study objective or
             risk to safety for the subject.

          -  nodular rosacea (lesions greater than 5mm with more than 2 modules)

clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1, Open Label, Multiple Center Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics of Once-Daily CLS001 Topical Gel Under Maximal Use Conditions Administered for 21 Days in Subjects With Papulopustular Rosacea

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Plasma concentrations of CLS001 to determine pharmacokinetic parameters at visit 2, visit 3 and visit 5.
primary_outcome.measure: Plasma concentrations of CLS001 to determine pharmacokinetic parameters at visit 2, visit 3 and visit 5

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Pharmacokinetics Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
